title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: Then there was a lovely road along Moffat Water, with a succession ofwild green dells and hillsides cleft with fern-choked ravines.

title: The Heather-Moon
author: Williamson, C. N. (Charles Norris)
snippet: Then there was a lovely road along Moffat Water, with a succession ofwild green dells and hillsides cleft with fern-choked ravines.

title: Old Mortality, Complete
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: This horse was so fleet, and its rider so expert, that they are said     to have outstripped and coted, or turned, a hare upon the Bran-Law,     near the head of Moffat Water, where the descent is so precipitous,     that no merely earthly horse could keep its feet, or merely mortal     rider could keep the saddle.

title: Life of Jane Welsh Carlyle,
author: Ireland, Annie Elizabeth (Nicholson)
snippet: Grace Welsh's father, Walter Welsh, was a prosperous stock-farmer, then living at Capelgill, on Moffat Water.
